alert.note: Alert for Quitman; Randolph (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 18 at 11:58AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Randolph and Quitman Counties through 1245 PM EDT... At 1158 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Georgetown, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cuthbert, Georgetown, Shellman, Springvale Station, Wire Bridge, Pachitla, Bonapartes Retreat, Peterson Hill, Coles, White House, Crossroads, Hatcher, Morris, Martins Crossroads, Brooksville, Benevolence, Springvale and Wades. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for southwestern Georgia.
